intro: Centropogon alsophilus, commonly known as the Florida sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, often found in coastal dunes and scrub habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Centropogon alsophilus is considered a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
